理想既係4:2

For the Nuggets to have significant cap space in a couple of months, they will need to:

Turn down their team option on Millsap's third contract year currently set for $30.5 million, and then renounce their rights to him.
Trade Barton and Plumlee to teams with cap space willing to absorb their contracts, which won't come for free and will cost Denver picks.
Renounce their rights on Trey Lyles, Isaiah Thomas, and Tyler Lydon.

That laundry list may appear simple, but rest assured, it is not. Denver would undoubtedly have to forfeit numerous draft picks for any team to take on either Barton or Plumlee, and here both would need to be moved elsewhere making that situation extremely costly for the Nuggets. They already owe Brooklyn their 2019 first-round selection (#27) this year for the Kenneth Faried deal, and have traded away their second-round picks starting from this year up to, and including, 2021. More than likely, a team would ask for Michael Porter Jr in return.

If successful of these endeavors however, Denver would be on the hook for the contracts of Jokic, Harris, Murray, Porter Jr, Juan Hernangomez, Torrey Craig, Malik Beasley, Monte Morris, and Jarred Vanderbilt, totalling just $60,920,149 coming into July for nine players. Add in three incomplete roster charges (also known as cap holds, which will be required for any roster consisting of less than 12 signed players) each worth $897,158 and Denver would have a collective cap hit of $63,611,623 on an estimated cap of $109 million, leaving them with more than $45 million in available cap space. Should Porter Jr be included in a trade, as opposed to draft picks, his cap hit of just over $3.3 million would be replaced by another cap hold worth $897,158 further increasing Denver's available money to the tune of over $47 million.

quote.msg:
For the Nuggets to have significant cap space in a couple of months, they will need to:

Turn down their team option on Millsap's third contract year currently set for $30.5 million, and then renounce their rights to him.
Trade Barton and Plumlee to teams with cap space willing to absorb their contracts, which won't come for free and will cost Denver picks.
Renounce their rights on Trey Lyles, Isaiah Thomas, and Tyler Lydon.

That laundry list may appear simple, but rest assured, it is not. Denver would undoubtedly have to forfeit numerous draft picks for any team to take on either Barton or Plumlee, and here both would need to be moved elsewhere making that situation extremely costly for the Nuggets. They already owe Brooklyn their 2019 first-round selection (#27) this year for the Kenneth Faried deal, and have traded away their second-round picks starting from this year up to, and including, 2021. More than likely, a team would ask for Michael Porter Jr in return.

If successful of these endeavors however, Denver would be on the hook for the contracts of Jokic, Harris, Murray, Porter Jr, Juan Hernangomez, Torrey Craig, Malik Beasley, Monte Morris, and Jarred Vanderbilt, totalling just $60,920,149 coming into July for nine players. Add in three incomplete roster charges (also known as cap holds, which will be required for any roster consisting of less than 12 signed players) each worth $897,158 and Denver would have a collective cap hit of $63,611,623 on an estimated cap of $109 million, leaving them with more than $45 million in available cap space. Season: 54W28L, 西2完季, 超出預期, 雖然全季多傷兵, 但反而變咗金塊既優點, 將士用命, 拼搏贏下每一場
Playoff: 2輪完成, 算符合預期, 但可以更進一步, 唔個別評論球員啦, 整體看係領先情況下都唔能夠堅定打沉對手 (spurs G7, Por G6,7), 希望下年可以改善

陣容配置:
1. 3號位置undersize問題頗嚴重, 下年必須解決 (不論係重用MPJ / 簽新球員)
2. 4號位重簽millsap多1/2年當過渡, 定下定決心幫joker揾件長期搭檔, 都係一個幾重要既議題
3. 後場 1/2號位可以繼續用 murray/harris. monte/beasley, 無需郁動, 相信下年會更進一步(無論心智, 技術, 默契)

PS. 小弟一向係lihkg CD-rom, 係喱到算留得最多言, 幾開心喱到既和諧氣氛, 但相信金塊會越黎越多hater(季尾都出現唔少), 希望喱到可以繼續保持和諧, 唔好有罵戰
lm等睇塊post用到下季playoff
